index.php.title: Enable
index.php.desc: A website that shows web developers how to make their work accessible.

accessible-text-svg.php.title: Accessible Text in SVG
accessible-text-svg.php.desc: How to ensure text in SVG respects WCAG 1.4.4 (Resize text) and WCAG 1.4.12 (Text Spacing)

alert.php.title: ARIA Alert
alert.php.desc: How to let screen reader users know when new information appears on the page using the ARIA alert role or the HTML5 output tag

animated-gif-with-pause-button.php.title: Animated GIFs with Pause Buttons
animated-gif-with-pause-button.php.desc: How to code Animated GIFs can be paused using the HTML5 details tag

bottom-fixed-navigation.php.title: Accessible Bottom Fixed Navigation
bottom-fixed-navigation.php.desc: Making fixed navigation on the bottom (like Instagram's) accessible is possible using skip links.

button.php.title: Accessible Buttons
button.php.desc: Native HTML5 buttons are the best when you have existing inaccessible code, using roles can help.

carousel.php.title: Accessible Carousels
carousel.php.desc: If you absolutely need carousels, you should really make them accessible and easily bypassed for keyboard and screen reader users.

checkbox.php.title: Accessible Checkboxes
checkbox.php.desc: This page will show you how to code HTML5 and custom checkboxes in an accessible way, including indeterminate checkboxes.

combobox.php.title: Accessible Autocomplete (a.k.a Combobox)
combobox.php.desc: One exception to the First Rule of ARIA is HTML5 autocomplete using the datalist tag, which is not as accessible as the ARIA datalist role

date.php.title: Accessible Date Widget
date.php.desc: Depending on the browser, the HTML5 <input type="date"> is not keyboard/screen reader friendly. What is a web developer to do?

description-list.php.title: Description List (ne√© Definition List)
description-list.php.desc: Lists of name/value pairs should be coded in a definition list.  This page covers the HTML5 and ARIA variants.

dialog.php.title: Accessible Modal Dialog
dialog.php.desc: Modal dialogs are often not made accessible.  This page covers, step by step, how to ensure your are.

dropdown.php.title: Accessible Drawers (a.k.a. Accordions or Expandos)
dropdown.php.desc: No matter what you can them, dropdowns, drawers and expandos can be easily made accessible with just a little bit of markup.

figure.php.title: Accessible Figures
figure.php.desc: Often overlooked, self-contained content that is references in a document, like a photo, chart, diagram or code, should be marked up as a figure to help screen reader users understand context.

focus-styling.php.title: Focus Styling
focus-styling.php.desc: Many designers will turn off focus styles on web apps. There are better solutions that ensure they appear for only the users that need them.

form-error-checking.php.title: Accessible Form Error Checking
form-error-checking.php.desc: It is not hard to ensure forms work correctly with screen readers and other technology.

form.php.title: Accessible Form Structure
form.php.desc: Learn about proper HTML form structure.  You'd be surprised how often this is not done correctly.

heading.php.title: Accessible Headings
heading.php.desc: How headings are used by screen reader users, and how to code them in an existing document without a lot of rework.

hero-image-text-resize.php.title: Advanced Text Resizing
hero-image-text-resize.php.desc: How to make text in things like hero images be coded via HTML (WCAG 1.4.5) while still allowing text resizing (WCAG 1.4.4)

img.php.title: Accessible Images
img.php.desc: How to code both tags and background images so they are understandable by screen reader users.

infographic.php.title: Accessible Infographics
infographic.php.desc: How to code SVG and bitmap images so they are understandable by screen reader users.

input-mask.php.title: Accessible Input Masking
input-mask.php.desc: How to code masking of keyboard input in form fields so they are accessible.

link.php.title: Accessible Links
link.php.desc: Links are easy to code accessibly, but it's nice to give more context

listbox.php.title: Accessible Select Boxes (a.k.a. Listboxes)
listbox.php.desc: Why it's preferable to use native HTML5 <select> controls vs custom controls, and what developers must do if they have to use a custom one.

log.php.title: Accessible Log Displays
log.php.desc: When you want up-to-date inbound information, like chat history or error logs, to be consumed by users of assistive technology, use the log role.

marquee.php.title: The Marquee (a.k.a. Auto-Scrolling Content)
marquee.php.desc: Non essential information that updates frequently should be coded so screen reader users know it's there, but that it doesn't annoy them.

math.php.title: Accessible Math Equations
math.php.desc: Math equations can be made accessible to math students and scholars with MathML.

meter.php.title: Meter
meter.php.desc: Meter component which is supported by non html5 browsers.

multi-level-hamburger-menu.php.title: Accessible Flyout/Hamburger Hybrid Menus
multi-level-hamburger-menu.php.desc: A hard thing to code from scratch, many developers will use an existing library to create hybrid flyout/hamburger menus.  Most of them aren't accessible. Let's show you how they can be.

pause-anim-control.php.title: Pause Animation Controls
pause-anim-control.php.desc: Instructions on how you can create a global control on you site that pauses animations while respecting your operating animation system settings.

progress.php.title: Accessible Progress Bars
progress.php.desc: HTML5 Progress Bars should be coded so users who use screen readers and assistive technology know they are there what they are trying to tell them.

radiogroup.php.title: Accessible Radio Groups
radiogroup.php.desc: They way radio buttons are made accessible is slightly different than other form controls.

skip-link.php.title: Skip Links (That Work In Mobile Too!)
skip-link.php.desc: Traditional skip links (e.g. Skip Navigation Links) that are visible only on focus don't work on mobile. This page presents an example of one that does.

slider.php.title: Accessible Sliders
slider.php.desc: This page is a perfect example of why the First Rule of ARIA (i.e. don't use ARIA) is so relevant, especially for mobile screen reader users.

spinner.php.title: Accessible Numeric Fields
spinner.php.desc: Many developers think form fields with numeric values must always be coded as <input type="number">.  There are exceptions.

status.php.title: The ARIA Status Role
status.php.desc: If part of a page is updated (e.g. because of an AJAX call), users of screen readers and other assistive tech need to be informed.  Enter the ARIA role "status"

switch.php.title: The ARIA Switch Role  (a.k.a. Toggle)
switch.php.desc: A control with no native HTML5 equivalent, switches have become popular recently in web and mobile applications, but many are inaccessible to screen reader and keyboard-only users.  Here's how to code them correctly.

table.php.title: Accessible Tables
table.php.desc: Learn the small things you didn't know were needed for HTML5 tables. Also learn how to make sortable and paginated tables accessible to everyone.

sortable-table.php.title: Accessible Sortable Tables
sortable-table.php.desc: With a little bit of JavaScript, you can make your tables sortable, but you should make sure you mark them up correctly.

pagination-table.php.title: Accessible Pagination Table
pagination-table.php.desc: If you have a large amount of data, many developers will code pagination widgets to show small portions of data in the table at a time.  Learn how to make that UI accessible, or just use our NPM module to do this.

reflow.php.title: Content That Scrolls In Two Dimensions (a WCAG Reflow Violation)
reflow.php.desc: In all breakpoints, you should ensure users don't have to scroll horizontally and vertically to understand the content (with some exceptions).  This page talks about common solutions you can use to fix these type of issues.

reflow__example-of-issue.php.title: Reflow example
reflow__example-of-issue.php.desc: This is an example of horizontal nav that has reflow issues at smaller breakpoints.

reflow__example-of-product-tile-carousel.title: Reflow example
reflow__example-of-product-tile-carousel.desc: This is an example of a carousel that would have reflow issues at smaller breakpoints if it was not for the page indicators at the bottom, which is an alternative navigation to scrolling horizontally.

search.php.title: Search Form
search.php.desc: If you have a search form on your page, make sure it is coded correctly so it can not only be read by screen reader users, but also have the right landmark applied to it.

sortable-pagination-table.php.title: Accessible Sortable Paginated Tables
sortable-pagination-table.php.desc: Combine two accessible table scripts to make sortable and paginated tables.

tabs.php.title: Accessible Tabs
tabs.php.desc: Another control with no native HTML5 tag, many developers don't realize their tab components aren't accessible.  We've got your back.

textbox.php.title: Accessible Textboxes
textbox.php.desc: If you are using custom (i.e. non-native HTML5) textboxes, it's simple to add a few ARIA attributes to make them accessible, if you absolutely have to.

text-contrast.php.title: Accessible Text Contrast
text-contrast.php.desc: How can you check your design for text contrast issues? How about for text on top of photographic or gradient backgrounds? Read on.

text-resize.php.title: Resizable Typography
text-resize.php.desc: How you can ensure that your website's typography resizes/zooms for people that use their browser's text zooming feature.

text-spacing.php.title: Space-Adjusting Typography
text-spacing.php.desc: How you can ensure that your website's typography is legible for users that adjust text-spacing because of dyslexia or due to visual or cognitive disabilities .

timer.php.title: ARIA Timer
timer.php.desc: If you have a countdown or a timer on your page, tell users of screen readers and other assistive tech when it updates without too much noise.

tooltip.php.title: Tooltip
tooltip.php.desc: If you have a tooltip, ensure it follows accessibility best practices.

video-player.php.title: Accessible Video Player
video-player.php.desc: Videos on the web must have audio descriptions as well as captions to be WCAG AA compliant. Learn how to do so without a lot of cost and time and get a WCAG AAA transcript for free!

video-content.php.title: Accessible Video Content
video-content.php.desc: Is AI auto-captioning from services like Google, Facebook and Microsoft sufficient? Do you know what a transcript really is (hint: YouTube doesn't)? How can we make sure our videos don't cause seizures?  Learn how to make video content accessible.

zoomable-viewport-units.php.title: Accessible Viewport Units
zoomable-viewport-units.php.desc: Text measured in viewport units usually don't resize with a web browser's native text resizing capability.  Learn how to work around this.

chart.php.title: Accessible Charts
chart.php.desc: Demos of accessible charts using d3.js

acknowledgements.php.title: Credits
acknowledgements.php.desc: These are the people who have directly, or indirectly, contributed to the Enable Project.

npm.php.title: NPM Installation Instructions
npm.php.desc: Instructions on how to install Enables NPM modules into your own projects.

code-quality.php.title: Accessible Code Quality
code-quality.php.desc: What are the automated tools we use in Enable to ensure code quality.

exposing-style-info-to-screen-readers.ph.title: Exposing Style Information To Screen Readers
exposing-style-info-to-screen-readers.ph.desc: If you think the style of text on the page is important to screen reader users, how do you code it?

screen-reader-only-text.php.title: Screen Reader Only Text
screen-reader-only-text.php.desc: What is screen reader only text, when it should be used and how it differs from aria-labels.

bookmarklets.php.title: Bookmarklets to Test Accessibility Features On A Page
bookmarklets.php.desc: The bookmarklets on this page are designed to help developers check if certain features are coded correctly on a webpage.
